newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Current Australian Takeovers (A to E) -Oct 21.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Current Australian Takeovers (A to E) -Oct 21.

text.p: TERMS: A$0.75 cash per ordinary share.
NOTE: Conditional on 51 percent share acceptance.
Offeror is entitled to 9.99 percent of offeree.
TERMS: A$0.78 cash per ordinary share.
NOTE: Morgan Stockbroking will stand in the market for

a period of one month from October 8, 1996 to November 8, 1996. Offeror is currently entitled to 17.8 percent of offeree. Crusader Ltd said it would accept Marsford offer for its 43.36 percent in Allied in absence of a higher bid.
TERMS: A$4.64 cash per ordinary share, A$4.66 per
Ampolex preference share and A$7.00 per convertible note (closed May 10).
NOTES: Mobil is entitled to 99.73 percent of Ampolex
ordinary capital, 99.90 percent of preference capital and 97.0 percent of convertible note capital.
TERMS: A$2.45 cash per share, raised from A$2.40 a share
NOTES: Offeror originally proposed to acquire 50 percent

of each shareholder's holding but changed the offer to a full takeover bid on September 20. Offeror is entitled to 15.77 percent of issued capital. Directors have advised shareholders to take no action on the full offer at this time.
TERMS: One Darowa share for every two Caxton shares
NOTES: Offer conditional on 90 percent acceptance from
three quarters of the offerees. Directors advise shareholders take no action pending further advice. Offeror is now entitled to 88.78 percent of the offeree.
TERMS: A$1.10 cash per Command share or two shares
shares in Cairn for every thirteen share held or a combination of both.
NOTES: Offer conditional on 50.1 percent acceptance.
TERMS: A$0.70 cash per ordinary share.
NOTES: Offer conditional on 50.1 share acceptance and
Foreign Investment Review Board approval. Directors advise shareholders to take no action pending further notice.
TERMS: A$0.26 cash per ordinary share.
NOTES: Offerer proposes to acquire all the issued
capital of the offeree and it currently entitled to 61.9 percent of the capital of Doral.
TERMS: 10 Futuris shares for every nine Elders shares
plus 23 cents for every Elders share.
NOTES: Elders directors said they intend to recommend
acceptance of the bid in the absence of a higher offer. Offeror is entitled to 82.75 percent of the issued capital of Elders.
